newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian stock markets closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian stock markets closed for holiday.

text.p: Indian stock markets were closed on Monday for a holiday commemorating the birth of Babasaheb Ambedkar Jayanti, a founder of the Indian constitution.
The markets held special trading sessions on Saturday in order to give investors a chance to react the fall of the United Front coalition government, and start of new coalition negotiations.
The Bombay Stock Exchange top 30 index closed down 44.01 points, or 1.21 percent, at 3,589.72.
The National index fell 10.15 points to 1,003.25.
Calcutta last closed down 0.82 points at 99.75.
